channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Lee Peacock: Westminster murders suspect found with critical injuries
item.description: Police were searching for 49-year-old Lee Peacock in connection with the deaths of two people in Westminster.

item.title: Fulham supermarkets targeted by man with syringes
item.description: People who bought food at three west London shops are being told to throw it away.

item.title: Covid-19: NHS England prepares jabs plan for 12-15 year-olds
item.description: But any extension of the vaccination rollout next month will first depend on a recommendation from experts.

item.title: Birmingham 2022: Peaky Blinders writer to produce opening ceremony
item.description: Steven Knight joins the creative team for the 2022 Commonwealth Games opening and closing ceremonies.

item.title: Claudia Lawrence: Mum in 'utter shock' at new search
item.description: Joan Lawrence says "every single day is a nightmare" since her daughter disappeared in 2009.

item.title: Ingoldmells caravan fire: Inquiry continues into girl's death
item.description: A two-year-old girl's death in the blaze at Ingoldmells is being treated as unexplained, police say.

item.title: Service cuts may expose rural youth to county lines
item.description: Money to support young people is much lower in rural areas than urban and half what it was a decade ago.

item.title: Derriford hospital bed shortage declared 'critical incident'
item.description: Derriford Hospital in Plymouth is operating at 97% bed capacity amid a rise in Covid cases.

item.title: Planes in near-miss over Duxford during aerobatics practice
item.description: The UK Airprox Board says there was a "serious risk of collision between the two aircraft".

item.title: Extinction Rebellion: Nearly 200 arrests over four days
item.description: Campaigners have glued themselves to a giant table and formed a human chain around Oxford Circus.

item.title: Covid cases in south-west England highest among young people
item.description: Public Health England says among 15-24 year olds there are 1,700 cases per 100,000 people.

item.title: Is this England's most unwanted dog?
item.description: Lurcher Sue has been overlooked while almost 950 dogs at her shelter have found new homes.

item.title: Paralympics: Family joy at Dame Sarah Storey's 15th gold
item.description: Barney Storey says watching his wife win her 15th Paralympic gold medal from home was "surreal".

item.title: Blackpool man has Lake District tattoo so he 'can always see the fells'
item.description: A man from Blackpool has had the outline of a view of the Lake District fells tattooed on his arm.

item.title: DJ to hold Ministry of Sound fundraiser for twin brother in Covid coma
item.description: The twin of a DJ who fell into a coma after catching Covid is holding a club night to raise money for his care.

item.title: Hybrid electric plane takes first flight in England
item.description: Electric planes are "the future" and could revive local airports, industry experts suggest.

item.title: 'Marmite' Snake Pass road marks 200 years
item.description: While many enjoy its picturesque surroundings, in bad weather the route can see motorists stranded.

item.title: Newport County 0-8 Southampton: Saints claim record win as they crush Exiles in EFL Cup
item.description: Southampton secure the biggest away win in their history as they hammer Newport County 8-0 at Rodney Parade in the EFL Cup.

item.title: West Brom 0-6 Arsenal: Aubameyang stars as Gunners secure first win of season
item.description: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang's hat-trick helps Arsenal to a first win of the season as they beat a young West Brom side in the Carabao Cup.

item.title: T20 Blast: Hampshire Hawks upset holders Notts Outlaws to reach Finals Day
item.description: Hampshire Hawks reach T20 Blast Finals Day with a two-run win over holders Notts Outlaws at Trent Bridge.

item.title: Carabao Cup third-round draw: Man Utd host West Ham, Spurs visit Wolves
item.description: Manchester United will host West Ham while holders Manchester City draw League One Wycombe in the third round of the Carabao Cup.

item.title: Newcastle United 0-0 Burnley (3-4 pens): Wayne Hennessey saves send Clarets through
item.description: Wayne Hennessey has Burnley debut to remember as he saves two spot-kicks to help them beat Newcastle on penalties in the Carabao Cup.
